panels.title: First visual change
panels.description: The first visual change is when something for the first time is painted within the current viewport. It is calculated by analyzing a video recording of the screen.

panels.title: SpeedIndex
panels.description: The Speed Index is the average time at which visible parts of the page are displayed. It is expressed in milliseconds and dependent on size of the view port. It was created by Pat Meenan and you can checkout the full documentation [here](https://sites.google.com/a/webpagetest.org/docs/using-webpagetest/metrics/speed-index).

panels.title: Last visual change
panels.description: The last visual change is when something for the last time is changing within the current viewport. It is calculated by analyzing a video recording of the screen.

panels.title: Fully loaded
panels.description: Fully loaded time when the last of all assets is downloaded on the page. It is calculated using the Resource Timing API where we use the last downloaded asset.

panels.title: Total transfer size
panels.description: The total transfer size over the wire (compressed size if your asset is compressed) of all assets on the page.

panels.title: Avg last 24 hours
panels.description: The moving average of the last 24 hours median values for the visual metrics.

panels.title: Relative to yesterday
panels.description:
Last 24 hours averages of median metrics compared to one day back in time. 

Red color background means a regression, green a positive change and yellow that the change is within the margin of error. You probably need to finetune the thresholds depending of how flakey your site is.

panels.title: Relative to last week
panels.description:
Last 24 hours averages of median metrics compared to seven days back in time. 

Red color background means a regression, green a positive change and yellow that the change is within the margin of error. You probably need to finetune the thresholds depending of how flakey your site is.

panels.title: Relative to last month
panels.description:
Last 24 hours averages of median metrics compared to one month back in time. 

Red color background means a regression, green a positive change and yellow that the change is within the margin of error. You probably need to finetune the thresholds depending of how flakey your site is.

panels.title: History Speed Index
panels.description: The history of [Speed Index](https://sites.google.com/a/webpagetest.org/docs/using-webpagetest/metrics/speed-index) showing the current median value, the average median per day and the average median per week.

panels.title: History First Visual Change
panels.description: The history of First Visual Change (when something for the first time is painted within the current viewport) showing the current median value, the average median per day and the average median per week.

panels.title: History Last Visual Change
panels.description: The history of Last Visual Change (when something for the last time is changing within the current viewport) showing the current median value, the average median per day and the average median per week.

panels.title: History Fully Loaded
panels.description: The history of Fully Loaded (when the last of all assets is downloaded on the page) showing the current median value, the average median per day and the average median per week.

panels.title: DOM depth (avg)
panels.description: The average DOM depth of the page.

panels.title: DOM depth (max)
panels.description: The max depth of DOM elements on the page.

panels.title: DOM Elements
panels.description: The total number of DOM elements on the page.

panels.title: Document height
panels.description: The document height in pixels.

panels.title: Iframes
panels.description: The total number of iframes used on the page.

panels.title: Performance score
panels.description: The performance score (0-100) calculated by the [Coach](https://www.sitespeed.io/documentation/coach/) using performance best practices.

panels.title: Size
panels.description: The total transfer size by content type.

panels.title: Requests
panels.description: The total number of requests by content type.

panels.title: None 200 response codes
panels.description: All requests that are not a 200 HTTP Status Code.

panels.title: Max time spent in backend vs frontend %
panels.description:
The max time spent in frontend vs backend time. 

The backend time is the time it takes for the network and the server to generate and start sending the HTML. It is collected using the Navigation Timing API taking the responseStart minus navigationStart.

The frontend time is the time it takes for the browser to parse and create the page.  It is collected using the Navigation Timing API by taking the loadEventStart minus responseEnd.

panels.title: DOMContentLoaded Time
panels.description: The time the browser takes to parse the document and execute deferred and parser-inserted scripts including the network time from the users location to your server.  It is collected using the Navigation Timing API by taking the domContentLoadedEventStart minus navigationStart.

panels.title: Frontend Time
panels.description: The time it takes for the browser to parse and create the page.  It is collected using the Navigation Timing API by taking the loadEventStart minus responseEnd.

panels.title: User timings
panels.description: All User Timing marks created on the page using the [User Timing API](https://www.w3.org/TR/user-timing/).

panels.title: Navigation Timings
panels.description: [Navigation Timing API](https://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/) metrics.

panels.title: Third party transfer size
panels.description:
The transfer size of all your third party responses.  

The third party content (content other companies/organizations serve like advertisement, social media buttons etc) are defined by the requests that doesn't match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*

panels.title: First party transfer size
panels.description:
The transfer size of all your first party responses.  

The first party content (content you serve your self ) are defined by the requests that  match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*

panels.title: Third party request
panels.description:
The number of requests for all your third party responses.  

The third party content (content other companies/organizations serve like advertisement, social media buttons etc) are defined by the requests that doesn't match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*

panels.title: First party request
panels.description:
The number of requests for all your first party responses.  

The first party content (content you serve your self ) are defined by the requests that match the regexp you supply with the parameter *--firstParty*

panels.title: Total transfer size
panels.description: The total size over the wire for all assets served for this page.

panels.title: Total content size
panels.description: The total size for all assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size for compressed text/css/html/js/font content.

panels.title: Total CSS transfer size
panels.description: The total size over the wire for all stylesheet assets served for this page.

panels.title: Total CSS content size
panels.description: The total size for stylesheets assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of CSS responses.

panels.title: Total JS transfer size
panels.description: The total size over the wire for all Javascript assets served for this page.

panels.title: Total JS content size
panels.description: The total size for Javascripts assets served for this page. This includes the uncompressed size of JS responses.
